t: Psalm 106
Israel’s Unfaithfulness to God
Hallelujah!*pn Give*ln thanks to the Lord,*s for he is good; his*ln faithful love endures forever.
Who*ln can declare the Lord’s*s mighty acts or*ln proclaim all the praise due him?
How*ln happy are those who uphold justice, who*ln practice righteousness at all times.
Remember*pn me, Lord,*s when*ln you show favor to your people. Come*ln to me with your salvation
so*ln that I may enjoy the prosperity of*ln your chosen ones, rejoice*ln in the joy of your nation, and*ln boast about your heritage.
Both*pn we and our ancestors have sinned; we*ln have done wrong and have acted wickedly.
Our*ln ancestors in Egypt did not grasp the*ln significance of your wondrous works or*ln remember your many acts of faithful love; instead,*ln they rebelled by the sea — the Red Sea.
Yet*ln he saved them for his name’s sake, to*ln make his power known.
He*ln rebuked the Red Sea, and it dried up; he*ln led them through the depths as through a desert.
He*ln saved them from the power of the adversary; he*ln redeemed them from the power of the enemy.
Water*ln covered their foes; not*ln one of them remained.
Then*ln they believed his promises and*ln sang his praise.
They*pn soon forgot his works and*ln would not wait for his counsel.
They*ln were seized with craving in the wilderness and*ln tested God in the desert.
He*ln gave them what they asked for, but*ln sent a wasting disease among them.
In*pn the camp they were envious of Moses and*ln of Aaron, the Lord’s*s holy one.
The*ln earth opened up and swallowed Dathan; it*ln covered the assembly of Abiram.
Fire*ln blazed throughout their assembly; flames*ln consumed the wicked.
At*pn Horeb they made a calf and*ln worshiped the cast metal image.
They*ln exchanged their glory for*ln the image of a grass-eating ox.
They*ln forgot God their Savior, who*ln did great things in Egypt,
wondrous*ln works in the land of Ham, awe-inspiring*ln acts at the Red Sea.
So*ln he said he would have destroyed them — if*ln Moses his chosen one had*ln not stood before him in the breach to*ln turn his wrath away from destroying them.
They*pn despised the pleasant land and*ln did not believe his promise.
They*ln grumbled in their tents and*ln did not listen to the Lord.*s
So*ln he raised his hand against them with an oath that*ln he would make them fall in the desert
and*ln would disperse their descendants among*ln the nations, scattering*ln them throughout the lands.
They*pn aligned themselves with Baal of Peor and*ln ate sacrifices offered to lifeless gods.
They*ln angered the Lord*s with their deeds, and*ln a plague broke out against them.
But*ln Phinehas stood up and intervened, and*ln the plague was stopped.
It*ln was credited to him as righteousness throughout*ln all generations to come.
They*pn angered the Lord*s at the Waters of Meribah, and*ln Moses suffered because of them,
for*ln they embittered his spirit, and*ln he spoke rashly with his lips.
They*pn did not destroy the peoples as*ln the Lord*s had commanded them
but*ln mingled with the nations and*ln adopted their ways.
They*ln served their idols, which*ln became a snare to them.
They*ln sacrificed their sons and daughters to demons.
They*ln shed innocent blood — the*ln blood of their sons and daughters whom*ln they sacrificed to the idols of Canaan; so*ln the land became polluted with blood.
They*ln defiled themselves by their actions and*ln prostituted themselves by their deeds.
Therefore*pn the Lord’s*s anger burned against his people, and*ln he abhorred his own inheritance.
He*ln handed them over to the nations; those*ln who hated them ruled over them.
Their*ln enemies oppressed them, and*ln they were subdued under their power.
He*ln rescued them many times, but*ln they continued to rebel deliberately and*ln were beaten down by their iniquity.
When*pn he heard their cry, he*ln took note of their distress,
remembered*ln his covenant with them, and*ln relented according to the abundance of*ln his faithful love.
He*ln caused them to be pitied before*ln all their captors.
Save*pn us, Lord*s our God, and*ln gather us from the nations, so*ln that we may give thanks to your holy name and*ln rejoice in your praise.
Blessed*pn be the Lord*s God of Israel, from*ln everlasting to everlasting. Let*ln all the people say, “Amen!” Hallelujah!*ln
BOOK V
(Psalms 107–150)
